definition: popular jargon/catchword
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
to tell to
dialect/language/speech

sentences.english: To choose the catchword of 2008, Simulated Culture must be included.
sentences.chinese: 评选2008年流行语，“山寨”当有一席之地。

sentences.english: This paper mainly analyzes catchphrases in China.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要对当代中国的流行语进行分析。

sentences.english: Hereby, the paper focuses the discussion on popular dialects and social catchphrases.
sentences.chinese: 在此，重点探讨一下方言流行语和社会流行语。

sentences.english: Hereby, the paper focuses the discussion on popular dialects and social catchphrases.
sentences.chinese: 在此，重点探讨一下方言流行语和社会流行语。

sentences.english: Pardonable also the catchword this year is particularly popular.
sentences.chinese: 也难怪今年的流行语非凡流行。

sentences.english: As always, “stability” is the catchword for China.
sentences.chinese: 一如既往，“稳定”是描述中国的流行语。
他突然想到这句流行语。

sentences.english: It also ventures to identify the various causes underlying semantic uncertainness of catchwords.
sentences.chinese: 同时讨论了导致流行语语义不确定性的原因。

sentences.english: Into the village of staff Catchwords.
sentences.chinese: 成为村里工作人员的流行语。

sentences.english: One thing we have plenty of in the enterprise software industry are buzzwords.
sentences.chinese: 企业软件行业中会大量出现流行语。

sentences.english: Campus'popular language is a mirror reflecting state of mind of modern collegians.
sentences.chinese: 校园流行语是反映大学生心理状况的一面镜子。

sentences.english: Today I'll show you some Chinese catchwords, now they were popularising in Chinese internet communities.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，流行语风行于中国互联网的各大社区。

definition: see 網絡語言|网络语言[wang3 luo4 yu3 yan2]

Internet language/Internet slang/netspeak/cyberspeak
image macro/visual meme/sticker package/emoticon collection

item of storytelling or performed dialogue (folk arts)/sketch
quotation (from a book or existing source)

a line of verse/a sentence
wording
fan club
